value.title: AZ-104: Deploy and manage Azure compute resources
value.excerpt: Learn how to deploy and configure virtual machines, containers, and Web Apps in Azure. This learning path helps prepare you for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Create a Linux virtual machine in Azure
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we discuss how to create a Linux virtual machine using the Azure portal.

images.title: Create a Linux virtual machine in Azure

topItems.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Azure virtual machines (VMs) enable you to create dedicated compute resources in minutes that can be used just like a physical desktop or server machine.

images.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure

topItems.title: Manage virtual machines with the Azure CLI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cross-platform Azure CLI to create, start, stop, and perform other management tasks related to virtual machines in Azure.

images.title: Manage virtual machines with the Azure CLI

topItems.title: Add and size disks in Azure virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Understand and create the different types of disk storage available to Azure virtual machines (VMs).

value.title: AZ-104: Manage identities and governance in Azure

topItems.title: Manage access to an Azure subscription by using Azure role-based access control (RBAC)
topItems.excerpt: To grant access to a subscription, identify the appropriate role to assign to an employee. Understand when you might need to temporarily elevate your own access to regain access to a subscription.

images.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory

value.title: Control Azure spending and manage bills with Azure Cost Management and billing learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and control your Azure spending and optimize the use of Azure resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization

topItems.title: Predict costs and optimize spending for Azure
topItems.excerpt: Cost is one of the most important aspects of the cloud and can have a massive impact on your business. Azure has several tools available to help you get a better understanding of cloud spend and some best practices that you can leverage to help you save money.

images.title: Predict costs and optimize spending for Azure

topItems.title: Analyze costs and create budgets with Azure Cost Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use cost analysis to understand how your costs accrue each month. Use this understanding to create an Azure budget to monitor and alert on your costs.

images.title: Analyze costs and create budgets with Azure Cost Management

topItems.title: Save money with Azure Reserved Instances
topItems.excerpt: Save money by taking advantage of Azure reservations. Analyze and decide what to purchase and then learn how to make a purchase. Understand the benefits provided through compute purchases and optimize against any under use. Perform basic reporting on your reservations.

images.title: Save money with Azure Reserved Instances
Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization

value.title: Manage resources in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to work with the Azure command line and web portal to create, manage, and control cloud based resources.

topItems.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Azure supports three approaches to deploying cloud resources - public, private, and the hybrid cloud. Selecting between them will change several factors of the services you move into Azure including cost, maintenance requirements, and security. In this module, we will look at all three types and help you make an informed decision about which one to leverage for your services. We'll also quickly look at the service models supported by Azure which can help you determine the services you should start with when planning out an Azure deployment.

images.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure

topItems.title: Control Azure services with the CLI
topItems.excerpt: Install the Azure CLI locally and use it to manage Azure resources.

images.title: Control Azure services with the CLI

topItems.excerpt: Install Azure PowerShell locally and use it to manage Azure resources.

images.title: Automate Azure tasks using scripts with PowerShell

topItems.excerpt: Cost is one of the most important aspects of the cloud and can have a massive impact on your business. Azure has several tools available to help you get a better understanding of cloud spend and some best practices that you can leverage to help you save money.

value.title: Secure your cloud applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to secure your Azure apps and associated data with encryption, certificates, and policy.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate security into your architecture design, and discover the tools that Azure provides to help you create a secure environment through all the layers of your architecture.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
topItems.excerpt: Secure your web applications on Azure and protect your apps against the most common and dangerous web application attacks.

images.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production

topItems.title: Create security baselines
topItems.excerpt: Create security baselines

images.title: Create security baselines

topItems.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Your application requires service passwords, connection strings, and other secret configuration values to do its job. Storing and handling secret values is risky, and every usage introduces the possibility of leakage. Azure Key Vault, in combination with managed identities for Azure resources, enables your Azure web app to access secret configuration values easily and securely without needing to store any secrets in your source control or configuration.

images.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault
Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security

value.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB learning path
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to customize NoSQL data storage and distribution with the Azure portal, Cosmos DB extension, and Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

images.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale

topItems.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB storage
topItems.excerpt: You will compare the different APIs available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

images.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB storage

topItems.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to add data to your database and query NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB.

topItems.excerpt: Create an application that that uses an Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database. Store, retrieve and manipulate graph data and visualize it using Data Explorer.

images.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale

value.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: NoSQL data is an efficient way to store information that doesn’t map to the requirements of a relational SQL database. Learn how to use the Azure portal, the Azure Cosmos DB extension for Visual Studio Code, and the Azure Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK to work with your NoSQL data where you want, and provide your users with high availability, no matter where they are in the world.

value.title: Connect your on-premises network to the Microsoft global network by using ExpressRoute
value.excerpt: Connect your on-premises systems and users to Azure and Office 365 by using ExpressRoute for private, dedicated, and guaranteed throughput connectivity.

images.title: Connect your on-premises network to the Microsoft global network by using ExpressRoute

value.title: Connect your services together learning path
value.excerpt: Use Azure to create website front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that compute-on-demand and can also communicate with each other.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus
topItems.excerpt: Write C# code in a custom application that sends and receives messages using Azure Service Bus topics and queues.

images.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Connect sending and receiving applications with Event Hubs so you can handle extremely high loads without losing data.

images.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

value.title: Connect your services together
value.excerpt: Azure lets you create applications composed of various components: web site front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that perform compute-on-demand services. Azure also includes various communication strategies to let these various components pass data to each other. Learn how to leverage these communication services to create scalable, efficient solutions out of testable components.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

images.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Connect sending and receiving applications with Event Hubs so you can handle extremely high loads without losing data.

images.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a security and compliance plan
value.excerpt:
Build strategies around security and compliance that enable you to authenticate and authorize your users, handle sensitive information, and enforce proper governance.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Secure internal resources, external resources, SaaS applications, and more by using Azure Active Directory. Learn about the features and capabilities of Azure AD.

images.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory

topItems.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Create users in Azure Active Directory. Understand different types of groups. Create a group and add members. Manage business-to-business guest accounts.

images.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory

topItems.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
topItems.excerpt: Securely authenticate applications to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities for Azure resources give your app an Azure Active Directory identity.

images.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources

topItems.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Storing and handling secrets, encryption keys, and certificates directly is risky, and every usage introduces the possibility of unintentional data exposure. Azure Key Vault provides a secure storage area for managing all your app secrets so you can properly encrypt your data in transit or while it's being stored.

images.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory

value.title: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore core data concepts
value.excerpt:
Learn the fundamentals of database concepts in a cloud environment, get basic skilling in cloud data services, and build your foundational knowledge of cloud data services within Microsoft Azure.
You will identify and describe core data concepts such as relational, non-relational, big data, and analytics, and explore how this technology is implemented with Microsoft Azure. You will explore the roles, tasks, and responsibilities in the world of data.

topItems.title: Explore core data concepts
topItems.excerpt: Discover how you can organize and process data, explore relational and non-relational databases, and discover how you can process data in batches or using streams.

images.title: Explore core data concepts

topItems.title: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the different jobs roles associated with creating, managing, and using databases. You learn about the key responsibilities of these roles, and the tools that these roles use.

images.title: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data

topItems.title: Describe concepts of relational data
topItems.excerpt: Explore the relational model for databases, how tables are structured, how you can use indexes to improve query performance, and how you can use views to simplify complex queries.

images.title: Describe concepts of relational data

topItems.title: Explore concepts of non-relational data
topItems.excerpt: Learn about non-relational databases, and how they compare to relational databases. Understand the different types of non-relational databases commonly used by applications.

images.title: Explore concepts of non-relational data
Explore core data concepts

value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions or about Azure IoT, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Enabling digital transformation
topItems.excerpt: Digital transformation is a business innovation fueled by the explosion of the cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT).  and allows organizations with new ways to understand and transform their business.

images.title: Enabling digital transformation

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

images.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Assess the characteristics of Azure IoT Hub and determine scenarios when to use IoT Hub.

topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

value.title: AZ-104: Configure and manage virtual networks for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure and manage Azure network capabilities like connectivity services, application protection, application delivery, and network monitoring services. This learning path helps prepare you for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to configure networking in a secure way for your Azure virtual machines.

images.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines

topItems.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment
topItems.excerpt: A good Azure IP addressing schema provides flexibility, room for growth, and integration with on-premises networks. The schema ensures that communication works for deployed resources, minimizes public exposure of systems, and gives the organization flexibility in its network. If not properly designed, systems might not be able to communicate, and additional work will be required to remediate.

images.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment

topItems.title: Host your domain on Azure DNS
topItems.excerpt: Create a DNS zone for your domain name. Create DNS records to map the URL to an IP address. Test that the domain name resolves to your web server.

images.title: Host your domain on Azure DNS

topItems.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
topItems.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

images.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
Configure the network for your virtual machines

topItems.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
topItems.excerpt: You want to build great things on Azure, but you’re not sure exactly what that means. Using key principles throughout your architecture regardless of technology choice, can help you design, build, and continuously improve your architecture.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence

topItems.excerpt: Create a DNS zone for your domain name. Create DNS records to map the URL to an IP address. Test that the domain name resolves to your web server.

images.title: Host your domain on Azure DNS

topItems.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
topItems.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

images.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
Configure the network for your virtual machines

value.title: Create no-code predictive models with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Machine learning is at the core of artificial intelligence, and many modern applications and services depend on predictive machine learning models. Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to create and publish models without writing code.

topItems.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

topItems.title: Create a Regression Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Regression is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict numeric values. Learn how to create regression models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

topItems.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

topItems.title: Create a Clustering Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Clustering is an unsupervised machine learning technique used to group similar entities based on their features. Learn how to create clustering models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure
value.excerpt: Azure virtual machines (VMs) enable you to create dedicated compute resources in minutes that can be used just like a physical desktop or server machine.

images.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure

value.title: Administer containers in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: With this learning path, you'll create and manage your Azure Container Instances, and see how they can be used to provide elastic scale for Kubernetes.

topItems.title: Introduction to Docker containers
topItems.excerpt: Describes the benefits of using Docker containers as a containerization platform. Discuss the infrastructure provided by the Docker platform.

topItems.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker

topItems.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
topItems.excerpt: Azure Container Registry is a managed Docker registry service based on the open-source Docker Registry 2.0. Container Registry is private, hosted in Azure, and allows you to build, store, and manage images for all types of container deployments. Learn how to build and store container images with Azure Container Registry.

images.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
